title.narrative: Repurposing Grootvlei power station into a sustainable and agriculture area

description.narrative: A key challenge for South Africa is the transition in the electricity sector, seeking early investment in and preparing for mitigation in hard-to-mitigate sectors, and addressing the economic and social consequences of the transition: domestic coal fuelled 88% of South Africa’s electricity generation in 2019. Therefore, so solve this and related challenges, the Just Energy Transition (JET) initiative was launched.South Africa, Grootvlei (Mpumalanga)ESKOM, the 100% state-owned electricity utility supplier, stronglysupported by the government, is mainly operating coal power stations which have to be closed down in the future. One of themis Grootvlei Power Station (PS). To support JET, ESKOM hasindicated it wants collaboration with the Netherlands on the Grootvlei PS along two paths: a) feasibility/preparation for climate-smart agriculture development land b) working towards an integrated JET approach for Grootvlei Power Station (PS)Therefore, this project will deliver:• A proposal for a climate-smart, labour-intensive horticulture project on the Grootvlei PS site• A baseline analysis of the geographic, economic, institutional and environmental potential of the Grootvlei PS propertyIncluding an analysis of and report on the (type of) jobs potentialand training needs (analysis report jobs).
